.column[.content.gray[
Big data and **big data analytics**, mean news ways to process data, including personal data.

This new ways may be **perceived** as non-compatible with Data Protection regulation such as (UK's) Data Protection Act (**DPA**) and the EU's General Data Protection Regulation (**GDPR**).

This presentation discuss UK Information Commissioner's Office (**ICO**) paper on the matter, published in **September 2017**.

]]
.column[.content.center[

]]

.row[.split-15[
.column[.content[ ]]
.column[.content[##Why Big Data Analytics is different]]
]]
.row[
.split-two[
.row[.split-two[
.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray[
### .center.orange[Big Data]

- Large **volumes** of data.
- Data generated at **velocity**, i.e. real-time.
- **Variety** of data sources, enabled by new tech (IoT, 5G).

]]
.column.bg-washed-red[.content.gray[
### .center.orange.pr2[Big Data Analytics]

- Use of algorithms to **learn from data** and **act with data**.
- **Opacity** of the processing, due to the use of AI.
- A tendency to collect and use all possible data (**n=all approach**).
- **Re-purposing of data** in new and unexpected ways.
- **Using of new types of data**, including observed and derived data.

]]

]]

.row[.content.center[
<br/>
<br/>
.f2.orange[Compliance with Data Protection Legislation is a **must**.]
]]
]]

.row[.split-15[
.column[.content[ ]]
.column[.content[## Principles of Data Protection]]
]]
.row[.content.center[
<img src="img/main.png" width="67%" height="67%">
]]

---

layout: true
class: split-three 

.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray[
### .center[Fairness]
<br/>
<br/>
* Processing of personal data must by **fair** and **lawful.**

* Fairness doesn't necessarily mean individually unwelcome outcomes.

* Fair processing should account be **transparent**, take into account and avoid its **effects** and meet the individuals **expectations**.

<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/balance2-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]
.column.bg-washed-red[.content.gray[
### .center[Conditions for processing]
<br/>
<br/>
* If processing of personal data requires **consent**, it needs to be freely given, specific, unambiguous and informed.

* A **legitimate interest** is a necessary condition. This requires that an organisation needs to **balance** its interests against of the individuals.

* A big data, 'n=all' approach context means a **higher effort** to establish legitimate interest.

<br/>
.center[<img src="img/checklist-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]
]]
.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray.pr3[
### .center[Purpose limitation]
<br/>
<br/>
* The purpose for which the data is collected must ** explicitly specified.**

* Further use must **not** be **incompatible** with the original purpose.

* This prevent **arbitrary** re-use and requires active evaluation of purpose.
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/border-all-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]
]]
]]

.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray[
### .center[Data collection and retention]
<br/>
* Organisations may have **incentives to retain** all collected data.
* However, it shall **not be kept longer than necessary** for the purpose for which it is being processed.

* Despite "big data advantages", good **retention policies** and **enforced deletion** are necessary.

<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/hourglass-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]
.column.bg-washed-red[.content.gray[
### .center[Accuracy]
<br/> 
<br/>
<br/>
* Processed personal data must be **accurate** and **up-to-date**.

* Although it perceived that big data analytics can deal with messy data, **obsolete data may lead to bias**.

* Individuals have the **right to be correctly represented**.
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/tick-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]
.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray.pr3[
### .center[Rights of individuals]
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
* Individuals have the right to **access any personal data**. This may a challenge for bid data controllers.

* Individuals have also the right **not to be subject to completely automated decisions**.

* Decision algorithms need to be **explainable**.

<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/human-rights-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]

.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray[
### .center[Security]
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
* Data processors and controllers need to be aware that **big data can create new security risks**. 

* **Risk assessments** must address those new risks to achieve compliance.

* Big data analytics can serve as a tool to assess and **mitigate IT risks**.
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/security-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]
]]
.column.bg-washed-red[.content.gray[
### .center[Accountability and governance]
<br/>
* **Organisations are accountable** for the outcomes of big data analytics.

* This includes  potentially **discriminatory, erroneous and unjustified  decisions**.

* Accountability extends **beyond what is explicitly** stated in the regulation.

* Good governance, including **Data Quality** can help to address undesired effects.
<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/organization-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]
.column.bg-washed-yellow[.content.gray.pr3[
### .center[Data controllers and processors]
<br/>
* Data protection regulation distinguishes between **data processors** and **data controllers**.

* In a big data context, that **distinction can be difficult**.

* **Careful consideration** of roles must be taken into account when outsourcing - to ensure compliance.
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>
.center[<img src="img/people-svgrepo-com.svg" width="40%" height="40%" class="filter-purple">]

]]

.row[.split-15[
.column[.content[ ]]
.column[.content[## Conclusions]]
]]
.row[
.f3.pr3.gray[
* Big data analytics can bring **many benefits**.

* Personal data protection is a **legal must**, no matter any perceived incompatibility with any big data analytics approach.

* **Regulation is not an insurmountable barrier** for adoption of big data analytics.
]

]
